title.rendered: Snap Tech IT: CMMC-AB Registered Provider Organization

content.rendered:
Snap Tech IT is now a CMMC-AB Registered Provider Organization (RPO)

“I am so pleased to announce that Snap Tech IT has been approved by the Cybersecurity Maturity Model Certification Accreditation Body (CMMC-AB) as a CMMC Registered Provider Organization as an RPO!” says Karl Bickmore, CEO Snap Tech IT

In the CMMC ecosystems, RPOs provide advice, consulting, and recommendations to Federal Government subcontractors preparing for certification. RPOs are the implementers and consultants that help organizations prepare for certification but do not conduct certified assessments.

An approved CMMC RPO, we must maintain a focused proficiency with the CMMC standard and employ CMMC certified Registered Practitioners (RP) that have expertise in the CMMC framework and cybersecurity best practices. We have a history of providing Federal Government subcontractors with sound guidance in paving the way to certification, and now, we’re being recognized as a go-to resource by the CMMC-AB Marketplace, a listing of approved RPOs for CMMC resources.

Benefits of Working With A Registered Provider

Partnering with a CMMC-AB RPO is a real win for Federal Government organizations because it eliminates the need to start from scratch when attempting to harden your infrastructure for CMMC certification. You can be confident that you’re aligning with an MSP that:

  • Is authorized to represent themselves as familiar with the constructs of the CMMC standard
  • Has agreed to the CMMC-AB Code of Professional Conduct
  • Received CMMC-AB provided training
  • Has passed a commercial background check
  • Can participate as an assessment team member during the Provisional period

Snap Tech IT’s CMMC Readiness Offerings

Strengthening cybersecurity maturity to meet regulatory requirements is at the core of our readiness offerings. Our team is comprised of a deep bench of experts that offer extensive experience helping organizations shore up their cybersecurity maturity, coupled with a keen understanding of CMMC compliance & how it affects your organization.

Snap Tech IT is equipped to help organizations begin their CMMC with:

  1. Systems Security Plans (SSP)
  2. Plans of Action and Milestones (POA&M) for NIST 800-171 and CMMC requirements
  3. Remediation consulting & assistance for identified security gaps
  4. Compliance, monitoring, & ongoing maintenance in preparation for CMMC audits & formalized incident response

 

Additionally, Snap Tech IT helps organizations prepare for CMMC accreditation audits and guides organizations in the planning process to achieve the target level of implementation.

Our CMMC readiness offerings prepare defense contractors to have a successful outcome in their CMMC certification process. We view CMMC as not only an essential framework for protecting our nation’s assets, but good business practices to reduce your organization’s risks. We avidly encourage businesses to adopt the cybersecurity maturity framework alongside best practices well in advance of CMMC contract requirements to maximize positive outcomes.

CMMC implementation is a critical requirement that shouldn’t be left to chance. If you’re struggling with the next steps, contact us to ensure you’re prepared for this milestone.

About CMMC

The Department is committed to working with the Defense Industrial Base (DIB) sector to enhance the protection of controlled unclassified information (CUI) within the supply chain.

The Cybersecurity Maturity Model Certification (CMMC) framework takes various cybersecurity standards and best practices and maps these controls and processes across several maturity levels that range from basic cyber hygiene to advanced.

For a given CMMC level, the associated practices and processes, when implemented, will reduce risk against a specific set of cyber threats. The CMMC effort builds upon the existing regulation (DFARS 252.204-7012) by adding a verification component for cybersecurity requirements.

About Snap Tech IT

Led by technology veterans in the industry, Snap Tech IT provides IT management, cybersecurity, cloud services, professional services & data center services for small and medium-sized businesses nationwide, with offices in Atlanta, Phoenix, and San Francisco. Founded in 2001, Snap Tech IT delivers technology to solve business challenges, coupled with exceptional client experiences that enable businesses to focus on strategy & growth. Snap Tech IT has solved a multitude of technical challenges for clients, from minimizing cybersecurity risk & operational downtime to managing IT roadmaps tailored for client business needs. A dedicated IT partner that believes client success is their success.
